steps.conclusion: None. The response follows the language rule, includes the required International Law suggestion, uses proper English titles, keeps titles under five words, avoids level/joiner words, includes english_title and is_language_course=false for all items, and uses tabler- icons.
Slight redundancy: “International Law” and “Public International Law” can be considered overlapping or synonymous in many curricula, reducing diversity of suggestions.

Increase variety by adding distinct international law subfields (e.g., International Humanitarian Law, International Criminal Law, International Trade Law) instead of overlapping titles; ensure each suggestion is clearly differentiated.
